name: Cheese Ring
description: This zesty cheese ring can be also made as a log. The jelly may seem strange, but it is what makes this appetizer delicious.
recipeIngredient: 5 medium green onions, finely chopped (white parts only)
1 pinch garlic salt, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, mix together the Cheddar cheese, mayonnaise, green onion, cayenne pepper, and garlic salt until well blended. Coat a ring shaped gelatin mold generously with cooking spray. Spoon the cheese mixture into the mold, cover, and chill for 2 to 3 hours to set.
Unmold onto a serving plate, and pour raspberry preserves into the center. Arrange wheat crackers around the outside of the ring.

review.reviewBody: I made this the other day for a Mardi Gras get together and it was a hit!  I added 1/2 cup chopped pecans but otherwise I followed the recipe exactly.  I used an 8" cake pan that I lined with wax paper, mix everything up (except jam), poured it in and left to sit overnight.  When I was ready for the party, I inverted it onto a large plate, topped with the rasberry jam (I thought it would be prettier and easier to eat this way) that I surrounded with Wheat Thin crackers.  Super easy and tasty too!

Very delicious appetizer. I brought it to work an hour ago and have already given the recipe away twice. I added a package of cream cheese used a couple shakes each of cayenne and garlic powder and molded into a ball which I rolled in chopped pecans and covered with seedless raspberry jam. I think strawberry jam may go better with this dish but that's me. I also think this is much better on Ritz type crackers than Wheat Thins. Looks very fancy with minimal work and tastes fabulous! Update: I have since made this ball with red plum jam and I think it to be MUCH better than the raspberry and you can usually find a generic.

I've made this recipe a few times now and think it's great!  I did make the following adjustments: Add 1 block of cream cheese (I whip a room temperature block in the bowl prior to adding any other ingredients), in addition to cayenne and garlic salt, I also added onion powder, paprika and garlic powder (about 1/2 tsp of each.  I mix the seasoning into the cream cheese before adding the remaining ingredients).  I use a combination of sharp and mild cheddar cheeses (50/50 of each) and I make this dip the night before to allow the flavors to blend.  I also recommend using a 8" springform pan (lined and sprayed with butter flavored Pam) instead of the jello ring. Once the dip is turned out on a plate, top with raspberry preserves, chopped pecans and fresh raspberries.  It tastes great and looks fantastic!  By using a springform pan, you can get the dip and preserves in each bit...which is really yummy.  This is very simple to make and tastes great!
The ultimate appetizer. I like to add chopped pecans & prefer strawberry preserves & triscuits. LOVE it. You've got to convince people to eat the jelly with it - that's what makes it spectacular.

A friend gave me a similar recipe and it is a favorite. I don't use green onion just finely chopped yellow onion. Also black pepper instead of cayenne. She puts finely chopped pecans in the with the mix to taste. Put it in a jello mold overnight to get the flavor thru. turn over and put strawberry jam in the middle. Perfect with Riyz or tricuits. Delicious!

I have lost this recipe and thanks to the "search ingredients" this came up.  My original recipe calls for spreading the mixture into a small springform pan, then spreading the raspberry jam on top- I always served it on a cake platter for a nice presentation. I also use half mild and half sharp cheddar- this is so good and everyone wants the recipe!
I made this for a family Christmas Eve buffet and everyone liked it. I used strawberry jam in a center bowl inside the cheese ring with crispy wheat crackers. Would definitely make again.

What a great recipe!! I altered it a little by adding the green parts of the onions (great flavor and color!) use Lawry's Garlic Salt and sprinkling chopped pecan pieces over the top. My family & friends could make a meal of it! You won't be disappointed!!
It does sound weird but it is really good and everyone tries to get some cheese and some preserve on each cracker. I use strawberry jam rather than raspberry preserves. Everyone loves this.

Everybody liked this - I thought is was ok. I usually make another similiar recipe which uses 1 C mayo 1 C scallions and 1 Cup Cheddar baked in bread bowl until warm and bubbly. I think I will stick with that one - but if you make this one make sure you use the preserves. It would not be the same without it.
